tool_description: Tracks and analyzes call volume patterns across different time periods, identifying peak hours, seasonal trends, and capacity planning insights.

tracking_period.description: Period to track call volumes (hourly, daily, weekly, monthly)

department_filter.description: Specific departments to include in volume tracking

call_type_filter.description: Types of calls to include in volume analysis

include_abandoned.description: Whether to include abandoned calls in volume counts

error_messages: Invalid tracking period: Use 'hourly', 'daily', 'weekly', or 'monthly' for tracking period.
Invalid date range: End date must be after start date and both must be valid ISO 8601 format.
Invalid timezone: Provide a valid timezone identifier.
Date range too large: Maximum tracking period varies by granularity (hourly: 7 days, daily: 365 days).
Invalid department filter: One or more department names are not recognized.
Invalid call type filter: Use valid call types like 'inbound', 'outbound', 'transfer'.
usage: Provide tracking_period, start_date, and end_date as required parameters. Optionally filter by department_filter, call_type_filter, and set include_abandoned and timezone preferences.

total_call_volume.description: Total number of calls in the specified period

peak_volume_time.description: Time period with highest call volume

average_calls_per_period.description: Average number of calls per tracking period unit

volume_variance.description: Statistical variance in call volumes across periods

trending_direction.description: Whether call volume is increasing, decreasing, or stable
